revisions.*:
'''Henrik Palmstrøm''' (22 July 1900 – 1 February 1998) was a [[Norway|Norwegian]] [[actuary]] and statistician.

He was born in [[Ås, Akershus|Ås]]<ref name=ntb>{{cite news|title=Henrik Palmstrøm 90 år 22. juli|agency=[[Norwegian News Agency]]|date=4 July 1990|language=Norwegian}}</ref> as a son of professor Arnfinn Palmstrøm (1867–1922) and Henrikke Qvigstad (1864–1907), and older brother of judge [[Finn Palmstrøm]].<ref name=hvem>{{cite encyclopedia|year=1973|title=Palmstrøm, Henrik|encyclopedia=[[Hvem er hvem?]]|editor=Steenstrup, Bjørn|publisher=Aschehoug|location=Oslo|url=http://runeberg.org/hvemerhvem/1973/0438.html|pages=438–439|language=Norwegian|accessdate=15 June 2011}}</ref><ref name=hvem-finn>{{cite encyclopedia|year=1973|title=Palmstrøm, Finn|encyclopedia=[[Hvem er hvem?]]|editor=Steenstrup, Bjørn|publisher=Aschehoug|location=Oslo|url=http://runeberg.org/hvemerhvem/1973/0438.html|page=438|language=Norwegian|accessdate=15 June 2011}}</ref> He grew up in [[Ljan]]<ref>{{Cite news|title=Henrik Palmstrøm (obituary)|last=Hellern|first=Ellen Aubert|date=18 March 1998|work=[[Aftenposten]]|page=11|language=Norwegian}}</ref> and was active in politics from 1931 to 1933 as chair of the [[Liberal Left Party|Liberal People's Party]] local branch in [[Nordstrand, Norway|Nordstrand]].<ref name=merkbio>{{cite encyclopedia|editor-last=Hoffstad|editor-first=Einar|editor-link=Einar Hoffstad|title=Palmstrøm, H(enrik)|encyclopedia=[[Merkantilt biografisk leksikon]]|publisher=Yrkesforlaget|location=Oslo|year=1935|page=603|url=http://runeberg.org/merkbio/0691.html|language=Norwegian|accessdate=15 June 2011}}</ref>

He [[examen artium|finished]] his secondary education in 1918 and finished the actuary education in 1921. He studied in [[University of Copenhagen|Copenhagen]], [[Lund University|Lund]] and [[University of Göttingen|Göttingen]] from 1921 to 1923. He worked briefly in [[Statistics Norway]] in 1922 before being hired in the insurance company [[Livsforsikringsselskapet Brage|Brage]]. He was an actuary in Brage from 1926 to 1959, except for the years 1943 to 1946 when he was a consultant for the [[Ministry of Provisioning (Norway)|Ministry of Provisioning]]-in-exile in London.<ref name=hvem/> His brother Finn was exiled to London as well; this was because of the [[German occupation of Norway]].<ref name=hvem-finn/> Henrik Palmstrøm was married to consul's daughter Malene Marie Aagaard (1899-1964) from 1925; and later a second time,<ref name=hvem/> to Eirene Manuel (1912–2006), a British citizen of Greek descent.<ref name=obit1>{{Cite news|title=Henrik Palmstrøm (obituary)|last=Magnus|first=Morten H.|author2=Varvin, Kåre|date=18 February 1998|work=[[Aftenposten]]|page=11|language=Norwegian}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|title=Eirene Palmstrøm (obituary)|last=Hellern|first=Ellen Aubert|date=20 March 2006|work=[[Aftenposten]]|page=|language=Norwegian}}</ref>

From 1927 to 1942 Palmstrøm was in charge of courses in statistics at the [[University of Oslo]]. He took the [[dr.philos.]] degree in 1937.<ref name=hvem/> He specialized in pensioners' welfare, and issued the books ''Pensjon og samfunn'' in 1961 and ''Folketrygden'' in 1966. He edited the magazine ''Trygdenytt'' from 1972 to 1976.<ref name=ntb/><ref name=obit1/>

He died in February 1998 and was buried at [[Vestre gravlund]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.disnorge.no/gravminner/index.php?language=engelsk|title=Cemeteries in Norway|publisher=DIS-Norge|accessdate=15 June 2011}}</ref>
